classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as hexose phosphates. These are carbohydrate derivatives containing a hexose substituted by one or more phosphate groups.

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.

go-classifier.description: establishment of protein localization to mitochondrion
maintenance of protein location in mitochondrion

target.name: Phosphomannomutase/phosphoglucomutase
target.organism: Pseudomonas aeruginosa (strain ATCC 15692 / PAO1 / 1C / PRS 101 / LMG 12228)

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.

polypeptide.name: Phosphomannomutase/phosphoglucomutase
polypeptide.specific-function: Highly reversible phosphoryltransferase. The phosphomannomutase activity produces a precursor for alginate polymerization, the alginate layer causes a mucoid phenotype and provides a protective barrier against host immune defenses and antibiotics. Also involved in core lipopolysaccaride (LPS) biosynthesis due to its phosphoglucomutase activity. Essential for rhamnolipid production, an exoproduct correlated with pathogenicity (PubMed:10481091). Required for biofilm production. The reaction proceeds via 2 processive phosphoryl transferase reactions; first from enzyme-phospho-Ser-108 to the substrate (generating a bisphosphorylated substrate intermediate and a dephosphorylated enzyme), a 180 degree rotation of the intermediate (probably aided by movement of domain 4), and subsequent transfer of phosphate back to the enzyme (PubMed:11716469, PubMed:16880541, PubMed:16595672, PubMed:22242625).
polypeptide.organism: Pseudomonas aeruginosa (strain ATCC 15692 / PAO1 / 1C / PRS 101 / LMG 12228)

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Maltose-6'-phosphate glucosidase
polypeptide.general-function: Oxidoreductase activity, acting on the ch-oh group of donors, nad or nadp as acceptor
polypeptide.specific-function: Hydrolyzes maltose-6'-phosphate and trehalose-6'-phosphate. Is involved in the catabolism of alpha-glycosides accumulated via a phosphoenolpyruvate-dependent maltose phosphotransferase system (PEP-PTS). Is also able to significantly catalyze the hydrolysis of both 6-phospho-alpha- and 6-phospho-beta-glucosides containing activated leaving groups such as p-nitrophenol and does so with retention and inversion, respectively, of the substrate anomeric configuration.

go-classifier.description: oxidoreductase activity, acting on the CH-OH group of donors, NAD or NADP as acceptor

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.

polypeptide.name: Glycogen phosphorylase, muscle form
polypeptide.specific-function: Phosphorylase is an important allosteric enzyme in carbohydrate metabolism. Enzymes from different sources differ in their regulatory mechanisms and in their natural substrates. However, all known phosphorylases share catalytic and structural properties.

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Alpha,alpha-trehalose-phosphate synthase [UDP-forming]
polypeptide.specific-function: Catalyzes the transfer of glucose from UDP-glucose to glucose-6-phosphate to form alpha,alpha-1,1 trehalose-6-phosphate. Acts with retention of the anomeric configuration of the UDP-sugar donor. Essential for viability of the cells at low temperatures and at elevated osmotic strength.

go-classifier.description: cellular response to DNA damage stimulus
trehalose metabolism in response to cold stress

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Glutamine--fructose-6-phosphate aminotransferase [isomerizing]
polypeptide.specific-function: Catalyzes the first step in hexosamine metabolism, converting fructose-6P into glucosamine-6P using glutamine as a nitrogen source.

polypeptide.name: 6-phospho-beta-glucosidase BglT
polypeptide.general-function: Oxidoreductase activity, acting on the ch-oh group of donors, nad or nadp as acceptor
polypeptide.specific-function: Hydrolyzes cellobiose 6'-phosphate into glucose 6-phosphate (Glc6P) and glucose.
polypeptide.organism: Thermotoga maritima (strain ATCC 43589 / MSB8 / DSM 3109 / JCM 10099)

polypeptide.name: Glucose-6-phosphate isomerase
polypeptide.specific-function: Besides it's role as a glycolytic enzyme, mammalian GPI can function as a tumor-secreted cytokine and an angiogenic factor (AMF) that stimulates endothelial cell motility. GPI is also a neurotrophic factor (Neuroleukin) for spinal and sensory neurons.

go-classifier.description: negative regulation of cysteine-type endopeptidase activity involved in apoptotic process
negative regulation of neuron apoptotic process
transcription initiation from RNA polymerase II promoter

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.

polypeptide.name: Aldose reductase
polypeptide.specific-function: Catalyzes the NADPH-dependent reduction of a wide variety of carbonyl-containing compounds to their corresponding alcohols with a broad range of catalytic efficiencies.

go-classifier.description: maternal process involved in female pregnancy
positive regulation of smooth muscle cell proliferation
